document_data.name: Gloryblood
document_data.mainbody: '''Glorybloods''' were [[specialty priest]]s of the [[Church of Tempus]] who specialized in military tactics, strategy, logistics and morale.<ref name="WaPotR-p114" >
document_data.Activities: Glorybloods disdained commanding from afar, preferring instead to lead by example, often at the frontline of combat. They were intolerant of combat mistakes made by others, drilling such mistakes out of their comrades with skills practice.
document_data.Culture: These individuals radiated a sense of natural command and authority among others, distinguishing them from common soldiers and other followers of [[Tempus]]. Their presence inspired others among Tempus' faithful to fight harder for his glory. If ever forced to retreat a gloryblood would swear to one day finish the original task.
document_data.Abilities:
The glory of Tempus exuded from a gloryblood to all comrades within sight of them up to {{SI|150|ft|long=yes}}, making them more dangerous and effective in combat.

A gloryblood could not [[turn undead]] or cast [[spell]]s from the [[healing sphere]].
document_data.Possessions: A gloryblood's [[armor]] was usually battered and bloodied from its frequent use. Most favored [[chain mail]], [[splint mail]] or [[plate mail]]. They carried the weapon of choice that best suited them.
